00025 # The main package starts lower down.  First we define different
00026 # types of config objects.
00027 
00028 # Each config object might want to override the methods display_value,
00029 # entry_widget, and save_string

00031 ########################### config object defaults
00032 package configobject;
00033 
00034 use strict;
00035 use warnings;
00036 
00037 sub new {
00038     my $class = shift;
00039     my $self = shift;
00040     $self->{Module} = shift;
00041     bless $self, $class;
00042     return $self;
00043 }
00044 
00045 # Only input is a value to display, and should produce an html string
00046 sub display_value {
00047     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00048     return $val;
00049 }
00050 
00051 # Stringified version for comparison (with html param return value)
00052 sub comparison_value {
00053     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00054     return $self->display_value($val);
00055 }
00056 
00057 sub convert_newval_source {
00058     my ($self, $newvalsource) = @_;
00059     my $inlinevarname = WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Config::inline_var($self->{var});
00060     my $newval;
00061     if($newvalsource =~ /widget/) {
00062         $newval = $self->{Module}->{r}->param($newvalsource);
00063     } else {
00064         $newval = $self->comparison_value(eval('$self->{Module}->{r}->ce->'.
00065             $inlinevarname));
00066     }
00067     return($newval);
00068 }
00069 
00070 # Bit of text to put in the configuration file.  The result should
00071 # be an assignment which is executable by perl.  oldval will be the
00072 # value of the perl variable, and newval will be whatever an entry
00073 # widget produces
00074 sub save_string {
00075     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00076     my $varname = $self->{var};
00077     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00078     my $displayoldval = $self->display_value($oldval);
00079     return '' if($displayoldval eq $newval);
00080     return('$'. $varname . " = '$newval';\n");
00081 }
00082 
00083 # A widget to interact with the user
00084 sub entry_widget {
00085     my ($self, $name, $default) = @_;
00086     my $width = $self->{width} || 15;
00087     return CGI::textfield(
00088         -name => $name,
00089         -value => $default,
00090         -size => $width,
00091     );
00092 }
00093 
00094 # This produces the documentation string and image link to more
00095 # documentation.  It is the same for all config types.
00096 sub what_string {
00097     my $self = shift;
00098     my $r = $self->{Module}->r;
00099     return(CGI::td(
00100         CGI::a({href=>$self->{Module}->systemLink(
00101             $r->urlpath->new(type=>'instructor_config',
00102                 args=>{courseID => $r->urlpath->arg("courseID")}),
00103                 params=>{show_long_doc=>1,
00104                     var_name=>"$self->{var}"}),
00105             target=>"_blank"},
00106             CGI::img({src=>$r->{ce}->{webworkURLs}->{htdocs}.
00107                 "/images/question_mark.png",
00108                 border=>"0", alt=>"$self->{var}", 
00109                 style=>"float: right; padding-left: 0.1em;"})
00110         ) .
00111         $self->{doc} 
00112     ));
00113 }

00115 ########################### configtext
00116 package configtext;
00117 @configtext::ISA = qw(configobject);
00118 
00119 sub save_string {
00120     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00121     my $varname = $self->{var};
00122     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00123     my $displayoldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00124     return '' if($displayoldval eq $newval);
00125     # Remove quotes from the string, we will have a new type for text with quotes
00126     $newval =~ s/['"`]//g; #`"'geditsucks
00127     return('$'. $varname . " = '$newval';\n");
00128 }

00130 ########################### confignumber
00131 package confignumber;

00134 sub save_string {
00135     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00136     my $varname = $self->{var};
00137     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00138     my $displayoldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00139     # Remove quotes from the string, we will have a new type for text with quotes
00140     $newval =~ s/['"`]//g; #`"'geditsucks
00141     my $newval2 = eval($newval);
00142     if($@) {
00143         $self->{Module}->addbadmessage("Syntax error in numeric value '$newval' for variable \$$self->{var}.  Reverting to the system default value.");
00144         return '';
00145     }
00146     return '' if($displayoldval == $newval2);
00147     return('$'. $varname . " = $newval;\n");
00148 }

00154 sub display_value {
00155     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00156     return 'True' if $val;
00157     return 'False';
00158 }
00159 
00160 sub save_string {
00161     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00162     my $varname = $self->{var};
00163     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00164     my $displayoldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00165     return '' if($displayoldval eq $newval);
00166     return('$'. $varname . " = " . ($newval eq 'True' ? 1 : 0) .";\n");
00167 }

00180 ########################### configpermission
00181 package configpermission;
00182 @configpermission::ISA = qw(configobject);
00183 
00184 # This tries to produce a string from a permission number.  If you feed it
00185 # a string, that's what you get back.
00186 sub display_value {
00187     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00188     return 'nobody' if not defined($val);
00189     my %userRoles = %{$self->{Module}->{r}->{ce}->{userRoles}};
00190     my %reverseUserRoles = reverse %userRoles;
00191     return $reverseUserRoles{$val} if defined($reverseUserRoles{$val});
00192     return $val;
00193 }
00194 
00195 sub save_string {
00196     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00197     my $varname = $self->{var};
00198     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00199     my $displayoldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00200     return '' if($displayoldval eq $newval);
00201     my $str = '$'. $varname . " = '$newval';\n";
00202     $str = '$'. $varname . " = undef;\n" if $newval eq 'nobody';
00203     return($str);
00204 }
00205 
00206 sub entry_widget {
00207     my ($self, $name, $default) = @_;
00208     my $ce = $self->{Module}->{r}->{ce};
00209     my $permHash = {};
00210     my %userRoles = %{$ce->{userRoles}};
00211     $userRoles{nobody} = 99999999; # insure that nobody comes at the end
00212     my %reverseUserRoles = reverse %userRoles;
00213 
00214     # the value of a permission can be undefined (for nobody),
00215     # a standard permission number, or some other number
00216     if(not defined($default)) {
00217         $default = 'nobody';
00218     }
00219 
00220     my @values = sort { $userRoles{$a} <=> $userRoles{$b} } keys %userRoles;
00221     return CGI::popup_menu(-name=>$name, -values => \@values,
00222         -default=>$default);
00223 }

00225 ########################### configlist
00226 package configlist;
00227 @configlist::ISA = qw(configobject);
00228 
00229 sub display_value {
00230     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00231     return '&nbsp;' if not defined($val);
00232     my $str = join(','.CGI::br(), @{$val});
00233     $str = '&nbsp;' if $str !~  /\S/;
00234     return $str;
00235 }
00236 
00237 sub comparison_value {
00238     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00239     $val = [] if not defined($val);
00240     my $str = join(',', @{$val});
00241     return($str);
00242 }
00243 
00244 sub save_string {
00245     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00246     my $newval = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00247     my $varname = $self->{var};
00248     $oldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00249     return '' if($oldval eq $newval);
00250     my $str = '';
00251 
00252     $oldval =~ s/^\s*(.*)\s*$/$1/;
00253     $newval =~ s/^\s*(.*)\s*$/$1/;
00254     $oldval =~ s/[\s,]+/,/sg;
00255     $newval =~ s/[\s,]+/,/sg;
00256     return '' if($newval eq $oldval);
00257     # ok we really have a new value, now turn it back into a string
00258     my @parts = split ',', $newval;
00259     map { $_ =~ s/['"`]//g } @parts; #`"'geditsucks
00260     @parts = map { "'". $_ ."'" } @parts;
00261     $str = join(',', @parts);
00262     $str = '$'. $varname . " = [$str];\n";
00263     return($str);
00264 }
00265 
00266 sub entry_widget {
00267     my ($self, $name, $default) = @_;
00268 
00269     $default = [] if not defined($default);
00270     my $str = join(', ', @{$default});
00271     $str = '' if $str !~ /\S/;
00272     return CGI::textarea(
00273         -name => $name,
00274         -rows => 4,
00275         -value => $str,
00276         -columns => 25,
00277     );
00278 }

00284 sub display_value {
00285     my ($self, $val) = @_;

00288     return join(CGI::br(), @vals);
00289 }

00291 # here r->param() returns an array, so we need a custom
00292 # version of convert_newval_source
00293 
00294 sub convert_newval_source {
00295     my ($self, $newvalsource) = @_;
00296     my $inlinevarname = WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Config::inline_var($self->{var});
00297     my @newvals;
00298     if($newvalsource =~ /widget/) {
00299         @newvals = $self->{Module}->{r}->param($newvalsource);
00300     } else {
00301         my $newval = eval('$self->{Module}->{r}->{ce}->'. $inlinevarname);
00302         @newvals = @$newval;
00303     }
00304     return(@newvals);
00305 }
00306 
00307 # Bit of text to put in the configuration file.  The result should
00308 sub save_string {
00309     my ($self, $oldval, $newvalsource) = @_;
00310     my $varname = $self->{var};
00311     my @newvals = $self->convert_newval_source($newvalsource);
00312     if($self->{min} and (scalar(@newvals) < $self->{min})) {
00313         $self->{Module}->addbadmessage("You need to select at least $self->{min} display mode.");
00314         if($newvalsource =~ /widget/) {
00315             return $self->save_string($oldval, 'current'); # try to return the old saved value
00316         } else {
00317             return '' ; # the previous saved value was empty, reset to system default
00318         }
00319     }
00320     $oldval = $self->comparison_value($oldval);
00321     my $newval =  $self->comparison_value(\@newvals);
00322     return '' if($oldval eq $newval);
00323     @newvals = map { "'".$_."'" } @newvals;
00324     my $str = join(',', @newvals);
00325     $str = '$'. $varname . " = [$str];\n";
00326     return($str);
00327 }
00328 
00329 sub comparison_value {
00330     my ($self, $val) = @_;
00331     $val = [] if not defined($val);
00332     my $str = join(',', @{$val});
00333     return($str);
00334 }

00398 ########### Main Config Package starts here
00399 
00400 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Config;
00401 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor);
00402 
00403 =head1 NAME
00404 
00405 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Config - Config
00406 
00407 =cut
00408 
00409 use strict;
00410 use warnings;
00411 
00412 use CGI qw(-nosticky );
00413 use WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment;
00414 
00415 # Load the configuration parts defined in Constants.pm 
00416 
00417 our $ConfigValues = [] unless defined $ConfigValues;
00418 
00419 # Configuation data
00420 # It is organized by section.  The allowable types are 
00421 #  'text' for a text string,
00422 #  'list' for a list of text strings,
00423 #  'permission' for a permission value, 
00424 #  'boolean' for variables which really hold 0/1 values as flags.
00425 
00426 # write contents to outputFilePath and return error messages if any
00427 sub writeFile {
00428     my $outputFilePath = shift;
00429     my $contents = shift;
00430     my $writeFileErrors;
00431     eval {                                                          
00432         local *OUTPUTFILE;
00433         if( open OUTPUTFILE, ">", $outputFilePath) {
00434             print OUTPUTFILE $contents;
00435             close OUTPUTFILE;
00436         } else {
00437             $writeFileErrors = "I could not open $outputFilePath".
00438                 CGI::br() . CGI::br().
00439                 "We will not be able to make configuration changes unless the permissions are set so that the web server can write to this file.";
00440         }
00441     };  # any errors are caught in the next block
00442 
00443     $writeFileErrors = $@ if $@;
00444     return($writeFileErrors);
00445 }
00446 
00447 # Make a new config object from data
00448 
00449 sub objectify {
00450     my ($self, $data) = @_;
00451     return "config$data->{type}"->new($data,$self);
00452 }
00453 
00454 
00455 # Take var string from ConfigValues and prepare it for $ce->...
00456 sub inline_var {
00457     my $varstring = shift;
00458     return '{'.$varstring.'}' if $varstring =~ /^\w+$/;
00459     $varstring =~ s/^(\w+)/{$1}->/;
00460     return($varstring);
00461 }
00462 
00463 sub print_navigation_tabs {
00464     my ($self, $current_tab, @tab_names) = @_;
00465     my $r = $self->r;
00466     my $str = '';
00467     for my $tab (0..(scalar(@tab_names)-1)) {
00468         if($current_tab eq "tab$tab") {
00469             $tab_names[$tab] = $tab_names[$tab];
00470         } else {
00471             $tab_names[$tab] = CGI::a({href=>$self->systemLink($r->urlpath, params=>{section_tab=>"tab$tab"})}, $tab_names[$tab]);
00472         }
00473     }
00474     print CGI::p() .
00475         '<div align="center">' . join('&nbsp;|&nbsp;', @tab_names) .'</div>'.
00476         CGI::p();
00477 }
00478 
00479 sub pre_header_initialize {
00480     my ($self) = @_;
00481     my $r = $self->r;
00482     my $ce = $r->ce;
00483 
00484     # Get a course environment without course.conf
00485     $self->{default_ce} = WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment->new({
00486         %WeBWorK::SeedCE,
00487     });
00488 
00489     $self->{ce_file_dir} = $ce->{courseDirs}->{root};
00490 
00491     # Get a copy of the course environment which does not have simple.conf loaded
00492     my $ce3 = eval {
00493         new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00494             %WeBWorK::SeedCE,
00495             courseName => $ce->{courseName},
00496             web_config_filename => 'noSuchFilePlease',
00497         })
00498     };
00499     if($r->param("make_changes")) {
00500         my $widget_count = 0;
00501         my $fileoutput = "#!perl
00502 # This file is automatically generated by WeBWorK's web-based
00503 # configuration module.  Do not make changes directly to this
00504 # file.  It will be overwritten the next time configuration
00505 # changes are saved.\n\n";
00506 
00507         # Get the number of the current tab
00508         my $tab = $r->param('section_tab') || 'tab0';
00509         $tab =~ s/tab//;
00510         # We completely rewrite the simple configuration file
00511         # so we need to go through all sections
00512         for my $configSection (@{$ConfigValues}) {
00513             my @configSectionArray = @{$configSection};
00514             shift @configSectionArray;
00515             for my $con (@configSectionArray) {
00516                 my $conobject = $self->objectify($con);
00517                 if($tab) { # This tab is not being shown
00518                     my $oldval = eval('$ce3->'.inline_var($con->{var}));
00519                     $fileoutput .= $conobject->save_string($oldval, 'current');
00520                 } else { # We reached the tab with entry objects
00521                     $fileoutput .= $conobject->save_string(eval('$ce3->'.inline_var($con->{var})), "widget$widget_count");
00522                     $widget_count++;
00523                 }
00524             }
00525             $tab--;
00526         }
00527         my $write_result = writeFile($self->{ce_file_dir}."/simple.conf", $fileoutput);
00528         if ($write_result) {
00529             $self->addbadmessage($write_result);
00530         } else {
00531             $self->addgoodmessage("Changes saved.");
00532         }
00533     }
00534 }
00535 
00536 sub body {
00537     my ($self) = @_;
00538 
00539     my $r = $self->r;
00540     my $ce = $r->ce;        # course environment
00541     my $db = $r->db;        # database
00542 
00543     my $userName = $r->param('user');
00544 
00545     my $user = $db->getUser($userName); # checked
00546     die "record for user $userName (real user) does not exist."
00547         unless defined $user;
00548 
00549     ### Check that this is a professor
00550     my $authz = $r->authz;
00551     unless ($authz->hasPermissions($userName, "modify_problem_sets")) {
00552         print "User $userName returned " .
00553             $authz->hasPermissions($user, "modify_problem_sets") .
00554             " for permission";
00555         return(CGI::div({class=>'ResultsWithError'},
00556           CGI::em("You are not authorized to access the Instructor tools.")));
00557     }
00558 
00559     if ($r->param('show_long_doc')) {
00560         my $docstring;
00561         for my $consec (@$ConfigValues) {
00562             my @configSectionArray = @$consec;
00563             shift @configSectionArray;
00564             for my $con (@configSectionArray) {
00565                 $docstring = $con->{doc2} || $con->{doc}
00566                     if($con->{var} eq $r->param('var_name'));
00567             }
00568         }
00569         print CGI::h2("Variable Documentation: ". CGI::code('$'.$r->param('var_name'))),
00570             CGI::p(),
00571             CGI::blockquote( $docstring );
00572         return "";
00573     }
00574 
00575     my $default_ce = $self->{default_ce};
00576     # Get the current course environment again in case we just saved changes
00577     my $ce4 = eval {
00578         new WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment({
00579             %WeBWorK::SeedCE,
00580             courseName => $ce->{courseName},
00581         })
00582     };
00583 
00584     my $widget_count = 0;
00585     if(scalar(@$ConfigValues) == 0) {
00586         print CGI::p("The configuration module did not find the data
00587 it needs to function.  Have your site administrator check that Constants.pm
00588 is up to date.");
00589         return "";
00590     }
00591 
00592     # Start tabs at the top
00593     my $current_tab = $r->param('section_tab') || 'tab0';
00594     my @tab_names = map { $_->[0] } @{$ConfigValues};
00595     $self->print_navigation_tabs($current_tab, @tab_names);
00596 
00597     print CGI::startform({method=>"post", action=>$r->uri, name=>"configform"});
00598     print $self->hidden_authen_fields();
00599     print CGI::hidden(-name=> 'section_tab', -value=> $current_tab);
00600 
00601     my $tabnumber = $current_tab;
00602     $tabnumber =~ s/tab//;
00603     my @configSectionArray = @{$ConfigValues->[$tabnumber]};
00604     my $configTitle = shift @configSectionArray;
00605     print CGI::p(CGI::div({-align=>'center'}, CGI::b($configTitle)));
00606 
00607     print CGI::start_table({-border=>"1"});
00608     print '<tr>'.CGI::th('What'). CGI::th('Default') .CGI::th('Current');
00609     for my $con (@configSectionArray) {
00610         my $conobject = $self->objectify($con);
00611         print "\n<tr>";
00612         print $conobject->what_string;
00613         print CGI::td({-align=>"center"}, $conobject->display_value(eval('$default_ce->'.inline_var($con->{var}))));
00614         print CGI::td($conobject->entry_widget("widget$widget_count", eval('$ce4->'.inline_var($con->{var}))));
00615         print '</tr>';
00616         $widget_count++;
00617     }
00618     print CGI::end_table();
00619     print CGI::p(CGI::submit(-name=>'make_changes', -value=>'Save Changes'));
00620     print CGI::end_form();
00621 
00622 
00623     return "";  
00624 }
